answers.answer: You need to speak with your Dr., you can't keep going on and off MTX.   Perhaps you need to check with your Dr. about changing or adding meds such as Enbrel etc.   Good luck to you.S.

question: Hi. I am a 45 year old woman with the following diagnosed conditions:  high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes (controlled with diet no meds), thalassemia minor, asma, fibromyalgia, RA, chronic venous insufficiency (right leg internal system), depression, anxiety, chronic and recurrent gastritis and gastroparesis.  I also suffer from herniated disks and severe muscle spasms in my neck and lower back (c6-c7, l4-l5, l5-s1).  My problem is that I've become afraid of taking my meds at times due the many side effects they cause (dizziness, insomnia, tiredness, blurred vision, stomach pains, headaches, etc.)  What most effects me is the stomach pain.  I am in constant pain in spite of the meds I take for this condiiton (nexium, zantac 300. reglan).  At times I've lost 4 to 5 pounds in a couple of days because I am unable to eat even less take my meds.  I have been taking Methotrexate injections, 80 cc a week to control my RA pain, but am currently using it only when I can no tolerate the pain.  Am I making my condition (RA) worse?
title: Am I making my condition worse?
